Ad Text:
Company description:



Snowy Hydro is a dynamic, integrated energy business that has been providing on-demand, reliable energy to Australia for generations. Snowy Hydro owns and operates a powerful combination of generation assets, including the mighty Snowy Mountains Scheme, gas and diesel plants, and contracted wind and solar energy. We also provide electricity and gas to about 1 million retail customers through our retail brands Red Energy and Lumo Energy.



Job description:

About Snowy:

Snowy Hydro is a dynamic, integrated energy business that has been providing on-demand, reliable energy to Australia for generations. Snowy Hydro owns and operates a powerful combination of generation assets, including the mighty Snowy Mountains Scheme, gas and diesel plants, and contracted wind and solar energy. We also provide electricity and gas to over 1.5 million retail customers through our retail brands Red Energy and Lumo Energy. Snowy 2.0 is Australia's largest committed renewable energy project. This nation-building project will provide on-demand energy and large-scale storage for many generations to come.

About the position:

The Head of Data and AI is responsible for driving business transformation by developing and executing a comprehensive data and AI strategy.

This will optimise operations, improve decision making and create new value across the Snowy Hydro enterprise.

Key Responsibilities:
Partner with business leaders to define and track key metrics that demonstrate the value and return on investment of data and AI initiatives
Build, lead, and mentor a high-performing team of data analysts, scientists, data engineers, and AI specialists, fostering a culture of curiosity, collaboration, and continuous improvement
Establish a robust data governance framework, including policies for data quality, security, privacy, and lifecycle management
Lead the identification of data, analytics, and AI to solve complex business challenges and unlock new opportunities
Manage the budget and vendor relationships for all data and AI platforms and tools, ensuring they are cost-effective
Act as Snowy Hydro's evangelist for data literacy and AI adoption

About the location:

This position can be based in Sydney or Melbourne.

About you:

High level of experience in leading and building teams of data professionals

A proven background in delivering complex data and AI projects to success

Strong strategic and financial acumen

Expertise in designing and implementing modern data architectures and platforms, including data lakes and cloud-based solutions

An ability to influence at all levels

Relevant professional certifications in data science, cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP), or AI are a bonus

About our workforce:

Snowy Hydro has a culture of decency and inclusion, with a commitment to the health and wellbeing of our people and a supportive environment to ensure that everyone - regardless of background - feels included and can succeed. At Snowy Hydro, we recognise that we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each individual brings, and we believe in providing an environment that allows that uniqueness to thrive.

Snowy Hydro is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for a role with Snowy Hydro and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an email with your request to the Snowy Hydro recruitment team at recruitment@snowyhydro.com.au





Position Description

Head of Data & AI

Company Description

About SEEK

SEEK‚Äôs portfolio of diverse businesses¬†make a positive impact¬†on a truly global scale. Our purpose is to help people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and help organisations succeed. We create world-class technology solutions to¬†connect more people to relevant¬†employment, education, small business¬†and¬†volunteer opportunities. We¬†have¬†a culture¬†of¬†high-performance¬†in our workplaces and¬†celebrate the diversity of¬†our employees¬†who¬†contribute to the¬†success of our organisation.

Life at SEEK

SEEK‚Äôs purpose is at the centre of everything we do.¬†Our SEEK, which defines the way we work, is all about what makes us unique and a little bit different. Passion, Team, Delivery and Future are our principles that drive innovation and creativity. SEEK strives to support employee wellbeing by providing an amazing experience at work which led us to being named AFR BOSS Top 10 Best Places to Work in Technology (2021-2024). We are proud to work in an environment that's inclusive where everyone's unique ideas, experiences and perspectives are valued.

Our award-winning head office in Cremorne (just a 4 min walk from Richmond station) provides an exceptional space to collaborate with colleagues. The building provides sweeping views of the city, a games area, sit and stand desks at every workstation, modern end-of-trip facilities and Thursday night drinks which gives our people an opportunity to connect in a social setting.

Job Description

Why This Role?

As a Strategy Manager at SEEK, you‚Äôll work on some of our most critical challenges‚Äîranging from marketplace evolution to commercial performance. Whether embedded in¬†Product¬†or¬†Commercial Strategy, you‚Äôll collaborate with senior leaders and cross-functional teams to define the "where next?" and guide how we get there.

You‚Äôll lead deep strategic thinking, apply analytical rigour, and turn insights into action. This role suits someone who thrives in ambiguity, is energised by solving complex business problems, and is excited by the opportunity to shape SEEK‚Äôs future at scale.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

‚úÖ Own and lead specific areas of strategic focus, becoming a go-to expert across the organisation
‚úÖ Develop and apply strategic frameworks to unpack business challenges and recommend high-impact solutions
‚úÖ Collaborate closely with leaders across Product, Commercial, AI and Technology to shape and deliver future-focused strategies
‚úÖ Provide clear, compelling communication of strategy across all levels‚Äîfrom senior executives to delivery teams
‚úÖ Champion strategic alignment and partner with execution teams to embed strategic thinking into action

The Opportunity

You‚Äôll join SEEK‚Äôs¬†global Strategy team‚Äîa high-performing group of ~40 ex-consultants from premier firms, working across APAC. With exposure to some of SEEK‚Äôs most senior leaders, you‚Äôll have a rare opportunity to shape the long-term direction of one of the region‚Äôs most recognised tech brands. Our team culture is caring, curious and impact-oriented, and we‚Äôre united by a shared purpose: helping people live more fulfilling and productive working lives.

Qualifications

‚úî Experience in strategy roles, ideally including time in a top-tier consulting firm or similarly fast-paced, analytical environment
‚úî Strong problem-solving and conceptual thinking skills
‚úî Experience in business-level strategy, including defining objectives and initiatives
‚úî Excellent stakeholder engagement and influencing capabilities
‚úî Passion for growth strategy, online marketplaces, or tech-driven businesses
‚úî Experience in tech, digital media, or internet industries is a plus

Additional Information

At SEEK we offer:

Support of flexible working, including a mix of office and work from home days depending on your role.
Paid and unpaid leave benefits including Personal Flexi Days and Volunteer Days, as well as the opportunity to purchase additional leave
SEEK is committed to operating sustainably, certified carbon neutral for its business operations (through Climate Active), purchasing renewable energy for our office and working-from-home emissions and a target for net zero by 2030.¬†
The opportunity to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per financial year
SEEKer Support, a confidential service that offers employees up to six sessions with a mental health professional of your choice
Tailored career development planning (including Education Assistance Program)
Free income protection insurance

At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart.

We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us.

Should you require any specific support¬†or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.

For this role, only those candidates with the eligible right to work will be considered.

SEEK kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees.

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst - Data Governance (Part-time role)
Ad Text:
We're partnering with a leading¬†Australian insurer looking for a Senior Business Analyst, who'll help drive initiatives that lift data quality, retention, and governance across structured and unstructured data.¬†

Part time role - 3 days per week
4 month day rate contract¬†
Sydney - hybrid working / can consider remote¬†
In this role you‚Äôll:

Analyse current data handling and storage practices to identify opportunities for improvement
Develop and document detailed business and technical requirements using formal templates and process maps
Support projects on data retention, classification, and privacy compliance
Partner with HR, data, and risk teams to ensure information is managed responsibly
Contribute to frameworks that strengthen data governance maturity
You‚Äôll bring:

Proven experience as a Senior Business Analyst within data governance and data management programs (structured & unstructured data)
Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong stakeholder management and communication abilities
Familiarity with SQL, SharePoint, and ServiceNow
Understanding of data privacy and information management standards
This role suits a business-focused analyst¬†with strong data experience - please apply now!

Senior Business Analyst ‚Äì ERP Uplift Project (EL1 Equivalent)
Contract: 13-month initial term with up to two 12-month extensions
Location: Canberra, ACT (onsite; flexible work considered)
Security Clearance: Must hold or be able to obtain a Baseline clearance
Key Skills: ERP business analysis, process optimisation, stakeholder engagement, data-driven decision support
Role
Join a dynamic government program driving the transformation of enterprise systems across the Australian Public Service. This role offers the opportunity to contribute to large-scale digital and process improvement initiatives, enhancing efficiency and performance across key service delivery areas. As a Senior Business Analyst, you will play a central role in defining business requirements, optimising workflows, and ensuring alignment between strategic objectives and technological solutions.

Your duties will include:
Lead workshops and consultations with business areas to identify and refine requirements.
Document and analyse business processes, success criteria, and improvement opportunities.
Collaborate across technical and business teams to define ERP solutions and ensure alignment with objectives.
Support business process re-design and mapping to deliver operational efficiencies.
Develop and maintain key documentation, including use cases, process models, and test plans.
Provide analytical insights to inform project decision-making and optimise delivery outcomes.
Skills and Experience we are looking for:
Proven experience leading the full business analysis lifecycle from design to implementation.
Strong background in ERP-related projects, including defining and documenting business and functional requirements.
Demonstrated success in process optimisation and business transformation within complex environments.
Experience working collaboratively with developers, architects, and subject matter experts.
Ability to create use cases, user stories, process maps, and impact assessments.
Experience in ERP systems or technology delivery within government will be highly regarded.
Application Process If you would like to apply, please contact Deep Ahluwalia on 0413 109 712 or email deep.ahluwalia@effectivepeople.com.au

Company: Talent ‚Äì Specialists in tech, transformation & beyond
Ad Text:
We are seeking an experienced Senior Functional Consultant with deep expertise in PeopleSoft Campus Solutions and proven experience in the higher education sector. This role will play a lead part in driving process improvements, delivering innovative solutions, and supporting critical student systems that underpin the student lifecycle.


Key Responsibilities
Partner with stakeholders to design, develop, and implement solutions that meet complex business needs

Lead initiatives to identify process improvements and innovative uses of PeopleSoft Campus Solutions and related student systems

Manage and deliver small to medium-sized IT projects, ensuring scope, risk, testing, and stakeholder engagement are well coordinated

Provide expert-level functional support for PeopleSoft Campus Solutions (including student information management, enrolments, results, applications, and progression), resolving complex issues and ensuring system performance

Investigate and resolve production problems, specify solutions, and oversee system testing, including user acceptance testing and sign-off

Ensure systems are configured to meet user needs, align with delivered functionality, and leverage new technology enhancements

Maintain the performance and integrity of student systems to provide accurate and efficient outputs to stakeholders

Engage proactively with business users to gather requirements, assess processes, and design fit-for-purpose solutions

Build strong collaborative relationships with technical teams, business analysts, developers, and student services teams

Contribute to the development of team standards, practices, and knowledge sharing

Mentor junior staff, supporting the growth of technical and functional capability within the team

Keep abreast of emerging technologies in higher education and assess their application in student system transformation projects

Ensure adherence to data governance, security requirements, and organisational policies

Skills & Experience Required
Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline, or equivalent experience in IT and student systems

Minimum of 5 years' functional experience

Essential PeopleSoft Campus Solutions in a business analyst, functional consultant, or systems support capacity within higher education

Proven knowledge of application development methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, Lean, Rapid Development)

Strong business analysis capability (e.g. Use Case Analysis, UML)

Advanced skills using MS Office, Visio, and project management tools such as MS Project

Excellent consultation, influencing, and negotiation skills with the ability to engage diverse stakeholders

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with initiative and flexibility in developing robust solutions

Outstanding communication skills, written and verbal, with the ability to foster effective relationships across IT and business teams

Experience mentoring or coaching more junior staff is highly desirable

Awareness of health, safety, and governance responsibilities within a large, complex organisation

Additional Information
Salary range: $145,000 - $155,000 + 17% superannuation

Flexible work arrangements available; may be considered relocation within Australia or NZ for candidates with the right higher education and PeopleSoft Campus Solutions experience

Role involves a balance of business-as-usual (system maintenance, patching) and project work (system modernisation, process improvements, student lifecycle transformation)

Upcoming initiatives include modernisation projects, scholarship management improvements, identity and access management, and academic calendar review

Are you a strategic thinker with a passion for improving transport performance and delivering smarter, data-driven solutions?

Transit Systems NSW is seeking a Service Planning and Performance Manager to lead our planning, scheduling, and performance analytics functions across Regions 2, 3 and 6.

About the Role

Location: New South Wales
Department: Operations
Reports to: Managing Director (NSW)
Employment Type: Full-Time

Package: Competitive salary including car allowance or company car, plus bonus payments

¬†

As the Planning and Performance Manager, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our operations through performance analysis, strategic planning, and continuous improvement initiatives. You will focus on optimising service delivery, ensuring efficiency, reliability, and alignment with business objectives and Transport for NSW requirements.

¬†

You will work collaboratively across departments and with external stakeholders to develop insights, strategies, and recommendations that enhance network performance, inform business decisions, and support future growth opportunities.

¬†

Key Responsibilities

Performance and Analytics:
Analyse and report on operational performance data to identify trends, risks, and improvement opportunities that enhance service reliability, efficiency, and customer outcomes

Strategic Planning:
Develop and implement forward-looking strategies that align with business priorities, operational goals, and regional transport objectives.

Business Improvement:
Lead or support initiatives aimed at improving operational processes, resource utilisation, and performance outcomes through innovation and best practice.

Operational Insights:
Provide data-driven insights and recommendations to inform decision-making and optimise network planning and service delivery.

Stakeholder Collaboration:
Partner with internal leaders, operational teams, and external stakeholders, including Transport for NSW, to support planning initiatives and performance reporting.

Reporting and Compliance:
Ensure the delivery of accurate and timely performance reports, dashboards, and analysis that meet internal and external requirements.

About You

Tertiary qualifications in Business, Transport Planning, Analytics, or a related discipline.

Proven experience in operational performance, analytics, or transport planning.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.

Demonstrated experience working with performance frameworks, KPI reporting, and continuous improvement initiatives.

Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability to influence across teams and levels.

Strategic mindset and a proactive approach to driving business outcomes.


Ready to drive performance, shape strategy, and make a real impact on public transport in NSW? Apply now and be part of our journey toward smarter mobility.

¬†

About Us



In partnership with Government, Transit Systems NSW innovates, designs and delivers public transport solutions that attract customers because they are easy to use, reliable, convenient and safe. To ensure ease of use, we deliver integrated bus services and transport networks, intelligently easing road congestion and increasing a city‚Äôs sustainability and liveability.

¬†

Transit Systems NSW is part of Kelsian Group Limited, Australia‚Äôs largest integrated land and marine, tourism and public transport service provider with established international operations in London and Singapore. With approximately 9000 employees, we are one of Australia‚Äôs most experienced and diverse multi-modal transport businesses operating around 4000 buses, 120 ferries and 24 light rail vehicles, carrying over 207 million customers where they need to go.

For more information about Transit Systems, please visit our¬†website


We aim to provide meaningful and sustainable employment opportunities that are free from barriers, support and celebrate the diverse talents of our team members, improve awareness of the value of diversity and inclusion across our organisation, and enable our leaders to champion diversity and inclusion. We welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, LGBTQIA+, people with disability and people from diverse cultural backgrounds.

Mirvac is a brand that creates and curates' better experiences. We are more than developers or builders - we are visionaries, and our ability to see the world differently drives us to be bold, embrace innovation and diversity, and lead with optimism.

As creators of positive change, we see each new project as an opportunity to leave a lasting legacy, delivering enduring value for all Australians. We focus on sustainability, innovation, and shared value, to return benefits to our customers, partners, investors, and communities.

Join us as we work towards building the imagine nation.


Why this role matters

This is more than a traditional L&D role. You'll be at the forefront of designing and delivering cutting-edge learning experiences that empower our people and align with Mirvac's strategic vision. You'll collaborate across teams, harness emerging trends, and create programs that spark curiosity, build capability, and unlock potential.


What you'll do

Lead with impact: Own end-to-end delivery of high-profile L&D projects that shape the future of work at Mirvac.
Discover and design: Use data-driven insights to identify learning needs and craft tailored solutions that drive real change.
Create experiences: Develop immersive, blended learning programs-from hands-on workshops to digital-first solutions-that energise and engage.
Facilitate transformation: Deliver dynamic sessions that inspire leaders and teams to think differently and grow confidently.
Measure what matters: Implement smart evaluation tools to track outcomes, demonstrate ROI, and continuously evolve our approach.
Partner for progress: Build trusted relationships across the business to ensure learning is aligned, relevant, and future-focused.
Stay ahead: Bring fresh thinking from the L&D landscape to keep Mirvac at the cutting edge of capability development.
Coach and mentor: Support individuals on their growth journeys with meaningful guidance and career development support.
Adapt and evolve: Embrace change and take on new challenges with agility and a solutions-focused mindset.


What sets you apart

You're a strategic thinker with a passion for learning innovation. You bring:
A relevant qualification in HR, Education, Organisational Development or similar.
7+ years of experience designing and delivering impactful learning programs.
Strong project management skills and the ability to juggle multiple priorities.
Exceptional facilitation and communication skills that connect with diverse audiences.
A collaborative spirit and the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
A growth mindset and a drive for continuous improvement.

About Us:

Sarah Group is a diversified construction and property group, leading a collective of companies with a strong reputation across the industry.

Established in 1961, we‚Äôre driven by a commitment to deliver exceptional experiences and create distinctive value. At the heart of everything we do is our purpose to build thriving and sustainable communities.




Reporting to the Group Chief Financial Officer, we are seeking a digital leader to shape and drive Sarah Group‚Äôs digital transformation. Our vision is to elevate, integrate and embed digital construction, artificial intelligence, and data analytics across our organisation and become the industry benchmark in these emerging capabilities.




The Role¬†

This role will partner with executive leadership to prioritise digital investments, champion innovation, and embed a culture of data-driven decision making. This role will help position Sarah Group as the industry benchmark for digital excellence in construction. You will be responsible for:¬†

Oversee and lead the Transformation and Data teams within Sarah Group.

Lead and execute a group-wide digital strategy aligned with business growth.¬†

Define the digital vision and roadmap for technology-driven transformation.

Partner with executives to set digital investment priorities and business cases.

Drive a culture of digital adoption and innovation across the organisation.¬†

Lead data strategy, governance, and analytics to enable informed decisions.¬†

Lead digital capability uplift across the workforce through training, change management, and leadership development.¬†

Leverage technology to enhance sustainability, safety, and community outcomes¬†

Optimise data infrastructure and unlock new value through data monetisation.¬†

Develop AI/ML strategies and scalable solutions to enhance project outcomes.¬†

Ensure ethical, transparent, and responsible use of AI technologies.¬†

Integrate digital construction technologies (BIM, IoT, drones, etc.) across projects.¬†

Oversee PMO delivery of digital initiatives with robust governance and performance tracking, partnering with other departments for cross collaboration opportunities to enhance delivery outcomes.¬†

Build strong partnerships with internal leaders and external technology partners.¬†

Foster high-performing, innovative teams that embody company values and continuous improvement.¬†




About You¬†

We‚Äôre looking for an experienced digital leader who combines strategic vision with hands-on delivery. You know how to translate technology potential into real business outcomes and thrive in environments where innovation and transformation are key.¬†




Qualifications, Experience & Skills¬†

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, Construction Management, or related field (Master‚Äôs preferred).¬†

10+ years‚Äô experience in digital transformation, data analytics, or construction technology, including 5+ years in leadership.¬†

Proven success leading large-scale technology initiatives and organisational change within construction, engineering, or infrastructure sectors.¬†

Strong knowledge of data architecture, analytics platforms, AI/ML applications, and digital construction tools (e.g., BIM, digital twins, IoT).¬†

Proficient in business intelligence, data visualisation, and cloud technologies (Azure, AWS, or GCP).¬†

Skilled in strategic planning, business case development, and digital project delivery using agile and waterfall methods.¬†

Strategic thinker with strong business acumen and results-driven mindset.¬†

Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder management abilities.

Collaborative, adaptable, and comfortable leading through change and ambiguity.¬†

High integrity, analytical mindset, and customer-focused approach to delivering value.¬†




Our Unique Value¬†

Alongside a high-performing team within a great working environment, we offer the following:¬†

Purpose-built office located five minutes from the Adelaide CBD, in Eastwood¬†

Generous leave entitlements including additional leave, volunteer leave, and paid parental leave¬†

Initiatives to drive a connected and collaborative team culture¬†¬†

Internal training organisation and bespoke development programs¬†

Professional development and training allowance¬†

Regular team social events and casual Fridays¬†

Salary continuance insurance¬†

Access to Novated Lease agreements¬†




In addition, our Health & Wellbeing Program includes:¬†

Annual on-site flu vaccinations and health checks¬†

$500 wellbeing allowance¬†

Bi-monthly massages¬†

Employee Assistance Program (EAP)¬†

Specialist wellbeing support¬†

Wellbeing room and facilities¬†

Fresh fruit and healthy snacks stocked weekly¬†




All applications are managed through our employment website; just follow the ‚ÄòApply for this job‚Äô link to submit or access more information.¬†

For a confidential discussion, please contact Tahnee Curzon, Group Manager ‚Äì Human Resources, tahnee.curzon@sarahgroup.com.au¬†¬†

Applications will remain open until Monday 24th November 2025, or until the position is filled.¬†




At Sarah Group we are an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage a diverse range of people to apply for our positions.

We're partnering with a well-known, ASX-listed services group undergoing modernisation and uplift. They're seeking a Senior Risk Manager to lead Line 2 advisory, sharpen risk culture, and deliver crisp, insight-led reporting to executives and the Board.
¬†
Why this role matters

Shape and execute the Risk Management Framework & Risk Appetite for a complex, customer-centric business.
Turn data into decisions: produce forward-looking, commercially relevant insights for senior leadership.
Own "risk in change" across key programmes and support incident management with clear root-cause actions.
Coach and uplift stakeholders; be the trusted advisor the business turns to first.
What you'll do

Provide independent oversight, challenge and pragmatic risk advice across business units.
Build data-driven reporting for ELT/Board (including high-incident summaries).
Support transformation initiatives and continuous improvement in risk processes.
Enable effective use of the GRC platform (e.g., dashboards, reporting, user enablement).
Deliver targeted training and strengthen risk ownership in the first line.
What you bring

Significant Line 2 (or Line 1/audit) experience in complex, regulated or listed environments.
A sharp commercial lens, excellent written communication, and senior stakeholder confidence.
Strength in analytics and turning the "so what?" into clear actions.
Familiarity with GRC tools
Relevant degree; professional certifications (e.g., CPA/ACA/CIA or risk postgraduate) valued.
What's on offer

Impact at executive level, visibility with ELT/Board, and the chance to cement risk culture during an exciting uplift phase.
Hybrid work and a collaborative, down-to-earth team.
Send your CV or a quick note to¬†Andrew Douglas¬†‚Äî andrew@crmrecruitment.com.au | +61 447 989 352

Take hold of a monster opportunity and join our Data and AI team as a Data Governance Manager.‚ÄØ If you‚Äôre a good fit for this role and live in Brisbane, Sydney or Melbourne, we‚Äôd love you to apply.¬†

Why join us?

You'll get 14% super as standard, to help your future come alive.
Unleash your potential and build a career to be proud of through excellent training and development opportunities.
Balance your work between in-person days at our purpose-built hubs and working from home.
In the office, enjoy end of trip facilities, a yoga and multi-faith room, parent and carer rooms, quiet rooms, BrewHub coffee facilities, and collaborative team spaces.

About the role

We‚Äôre all about helping our members make the most of their money. And while they go after their goals, you can too. As a Data Governance Manager, you‚Äôll:¬†

¬†

Leading the design and implementation of enterprise data quality frameworks, policies, and standards.
Defining and monitoring data quality metrics, KPIs, and dashboards across critical data domains.
Collaborating with data owners, stewards, and custodians to embed data quality practices into business processes.
Overseeing data profiling, cleansing, and remediation initiatives.
Driving continuous improvement in data quality through root cause analysis and corrective actions.
Supporting the implementation and optimisation of data quality tools and platforms.
Providing strategic input into data governance and data management programs.
Ensuring alignment with regulatory requirements (e.g., APRA, ASIC, Privacy Act) and internal risk frameworks.

This role is a permanent opportunity.¬†

üìç¬†Location: Brisbane, Sydney or Melbourne.¬†

About you

It goes without saying you'll be a great communicator with top notch interpersonal skills. We'll also expect you to pick up problems and come up with quick, creative ways to solve them. It's quite likely you tick some of the following boxes too:¬†¬†

Who is Vivi‚ÄØ

Vivi is the only wireless screen mirroring and digital signage tool designed for education. We help IT help teachers help students with classroom technology that enhances collaboration, control, and creativity.¬†¬†

Vivi exists because we all had that one teacher who changed our life, who went above and beyond to serve as a role model and sage.‚ÄØThey guided discussion, connected with their students on a personal level, were just as engaging and entertaining as they were educational, and they created a dynamic learning environment by constantly involving students.

Those teachers are the masters of the social classroom.‚ÄØPersonalised learning environments have been proven to deliver better educational outcomes for individuals through increased participation and engagement. To successfully create such an environment requires a fluid, visual dialogue between teacher and student. This is why Vivi exists.‚ÄØVivi is used by over 825,000 teachers and students around the world and is setting out to disrupt the enormous education industry with our high-growth, ambitious, and creative team. In this rapidly evolving technology landscape, Vivi‚ÄØis always looking for new ways to disrupt the classroom‚ÄØexperience, enhance customer experiences and expand globally.

Category: Records Management & Document Control (Administration & Office Support)
Ad Text:
This well-established federal government agency plays a critical role in supporting transparency, compliance and sustainable management of nationally significant resources.
¬†
As part of a broader transformation, the organisation is preparing to transition to a new records management environment and is focused on enhancing information governance and operational efficiency.
¬†
The Opportunity

Working as a senior specialist within the Information Management function, you will lead the review and redesign of the agency‚Äôs current enterprise records management structure. This is a strategic and hands-on role where you will assess the current state, identify gaps and compliance risks, and design future-ready solutions to support a planned system transition in mid-next year.
¬†
The contract is initially for three months, with a likely extension through to the end of the financial year. Due to anticipated budget constraints, further extension beyond that period is unlikely. Full remote work arrangements can be supported for the right candidate.
¬†
The Role

Assess the current records management structure, identifying inefficiencies, risks and improvement opportunities
Consult with stakeholders to understand recordkeeping needs, workflows and compliance obligations
Design a classification scheme and information architecture that aligns to current and future systems (e.g. SharePoint)
Ensure alignment with legislative and governance requirements, including National Archives of Australia standards
Provide documentation, uplift guidance and knowledge transfer to internal staff
Contribute to transition planning to support implementation¬†
The Ideal Person

You‚Äôll bring strong understanding of Commonwealth legislation and The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of Commonwealth legislation and compliance standards related to records governance. They will have demonstrated experience in managing information or records within complex or regulated environments, with prior work in the APS considered highly advantageous. Proficiency with Electronic Document and Records Management Systems (EDRMS), particularly tools such as Content Manager and SharePoint, is essential.

A strong analytical mindset is crucial, enabling the candidate to critically assess current-state issues and develop practical, forward-looking solutions. Success in this role also requires confident stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability to influence and drive change in challenging settings. The candidate should be self-sufficient and resilient, comfortable navigating ambiguity and working independently to deliver outcomes.

To be eligible for this position, you must hold a Baseline security clearance.

Candidates must be Australian citizens to be considered, and clearance will be arranged for successful applicants.
¬†
Salary / Rate

$65/hr - $80/hr + 15.4% Super
How to Apply

To apply online, please click on the appropriate link.
¬†
Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please Guy Butler-Manuel on 02 6108 4878 quoting ref no 21131.

Category:
Business/Systems Analysts (Information & Communication Technology)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
Computer Systems Officer Grade 5
2x Temporary Full-Time up to December 2026
Parramatta & Sydney Olympic Park


About us

The NSW Police Force (NSWPF) is one of the largest police forces in the western world, with more than 20,000 employees, including more than 4,000 administrative employees who support the sworn officers that provide a range of law and order services 24 hours a day, seven days a week to the socially, geographically and culturally diverse community of NSW.


About the role

We have an opportunity for 2 x Senior ICT Business Analysts¬†to be part of our Project Managment Office, Technology & Communication Services Command. The role works with relevant stakeholders to understand business needs; capture, analyse and document requirements; and support the delivery of ICT solutions that meet business needs.

Join the PMO team at NSW Police Force as a Senior ICT Business Analyst and help shape the delivery of technology solutions that support critical policing and corporate operations. In this role, you‚Äôll work closely with stakeholders to understand business needs, capture and analyse requirements, and support the delivery of ICT capabilities that drive strategic and operational outcomes.¬†

You‚Äôll bring demonstrated high-level business analysis skills and significant experience delivering analysis across complex programs and projects. Your ability to conduct gap analyses, develop business cases, and translate technical concepts into plain language will be key to optimising performance and enabling continuous improvement.¬†

This role also requires strong knowledge of architecture frameworks and governance project management tools, along with the ability to lead integration of new capabilities into enterprise systems while maintaining alignment with organisational strategy

View the relevant role description for more information on this role (e.g. essential requirements, key accountabilities, key challenges and capabilities required for the role)

What we can offer you

At NSWPF our people have access to a range of benefits that help balance life at work and at home. Some of the benefits available when you join the NSWPF include:

competitive salary;
flexible work options;
opportunity to purchase leave;
annual leave loading;
corporate wellbeing programs including seminars and the Fitness Passport;
free annual influenza vaccination;
salary packaging options via superannuation contributions or a novated vehicle lease;
convenient location for public transport and to shops etc; and
in-house gym facilities. (Parramatta)

How to Apply

Applications can only be submitted electronically via the I Work for NSW website.

To be considered for this role, attach a cover letter (2 pages maximum) and an up-to-date resume that clearly details your skills & experience as relevant to this role.

Please do not attach copies of qualifications, certificates or documentation (other than what has been requested) - you can bring these if called for interview.

Please address each of the following Target Questions (500 words per question) in the text boxes provided in the online application or attach as a separate document.

Target Question 1:

Can you describe how you‚Äôve worked across both technical and business teams to align ICT capabilities with business processes during a system enhancement or transformation project? What approach did you take to ensure the solution was scalable and strategically aligned with future needs?


Target Question 2:

Hello. We‚Äôre Virgin Australia. We‚Äôre the airline that‚Äôs always done things a little different. Our way. The Virgin way. We‚Äôre on a mission to make flying better than ‚Äònice‚Äô. What you‚Äôll be doing:

As the Transformation Lead ‚Äì Workforce productivity, you‚Äôll be the subject matter expert driving the delivery of complex transformation programs that shape the future of our frontline employee operations. In this position, you will play a pivotal role in analysing data, and identifying opportunities to improve labour productivity to ensuring our workforce is optimally aligned to meet operational demand.

This dynamic position blends hands-on delivery with strategic program leadership, supporting Virgin Australia‚Äôs mission to build a more efficient, commercially focused, and engaging operation.
